caption: Honestly, I used to think the trope 'the best pizza in nyc is definitely somewhere in Brooklyn, but you gotta find it' is pretty cliche and admittedly, I'm not a huge fan of pizza or Italian food in general since I get heartburn just by looking at the tomato sauce, resulting from working at an Italian joint in the past + having free lunches for 2 straight years, yeah lucky me! So when I was in town visiting my pal he insisted taking me to this place and boy, I stood corrected the moment I had the first bite. This place changes my view on pizza forever and I'd continue to sing praises and recommend Firefly to everyone (if we've had a chance to cross the border to come down for a visit again and soon, hopefully!). Bonuses: rustic vibe, great service and prices are on point!
worst guest treatment.  very rude staff!  especially the bartender girl with a pink bandana on her face.  very unprofessional and very rude.  several times fell on her rudeness.

Greasy, mushy food with a gritty aftertaste. I had a horrible meal from here a few weeks ago. The two vegan calzones we ordered were measly portions and both had this terrible grittiness - like the basil was unwashed. We had to throw both out. I called Bk Firefly to let them know and they hurriedly rushed me off the phone without offering to rectify the problem. Over 80 dollars for tiny calzones full of grit, a very small bland pizza and mushy potatoes that were ten dollars. Never again!! Save your money, go to Lombardo's or Screamer's Pizzeria!
Delicious, amazing atmosphere.
Delicious food!! A lot of vegan options (for my Dad)
Amazing food and even more amazing service.
So many new delicious vegan options, thanks Firefly!
May be the best pizza I have ever eaten.
Love this place. its a must!
Don't go, you can do so much better than this - just walk 100ft in any direction
Some of the best vegan pizza in the area
Service was good but the food was lackluster at best.
Normally I would have posted a pic but food looked so good I couldn't stop. The service here is attentive.
Solid pizza offerings in a quaint neighborhood. Good outdoor seating arrangements, stayed relativity warm on a blisteringly cold day.
Pizza has always been great here. Probably one the best in the neighborhood.
Great pizza, old school Brolin Brooklyn atmosphere and the best people.

they will not take your delivery order over the phone. they want you to use uber eats and other sites. the pricing on these third party sites is ten percent higher than their website menu, plus these sites charge an extra delivery fee.   BIG MISTAKE FIREFLY. I WONT ORDER FROM YOU NOW
Some of the best pizza in bay ridge.
Nope. Not coming back👎🏻
A classic bay ridge spot known and loved for its great pizza heritage is in great hands with Mister Kaves & Family!

One of the coolest spot in Bay Ridge. Music is always good. Pizzas are delicious (the Shroom is my favorite) the Arugula Salad is so simple but yet taste amazing. The place itself is super stylish. The bar looks beautiful And the drink menu is one of the best in the area. Crissy is very good at it. I try and go every week at least for a nice chat !!! +++++

Great place with nice ambiance considering the current situation. We were really surprised about the vegan options and how tasty they were. The Square pie had a doughy crust that was so light and chewy mmmm. That said I would like more sauce on their pizzas... Just a bit more .
One of my favorite local spots. Fun cocktails and great atmosphere.
Great service and very tasty pizza!
Amazing food. Amazing vibe. Just like coming over & having dinner at their dining room table. There's a whole lotta love felt here in this classic family owned establishment.
The wait is long, but the good is good.
One of the best pizzas I've ever had! The margherita was flavorful, perfectly cheesy and crunchy. Very attentive service, too. And a great beer selection.
Great outdoor setting and delicious pizza! Excellent staff and service.
Great food, lots of vegetarian/vegan options, pleasant outdoor space with plenty of seating on a Saturday afternoon.
Everything was delicious, service was excellent. Definitely will go back very cool place
Had the vodka pie and it was delicious. Very good vodka sauce with all fresh ingredients. The crust is a little thick, like a Sicilian, but it rly works well.
BAD SERVICE

I will not be visiting this place again. I've gone a few times and there have always been problems. One time they ran out of dessert and this time the pizzas I ordered were so burnt they were partially inedible. Not worth wasting my money here.
I love this place! The best drinks and food!!!Best place for anyone to go to. I sure love it

Ordered 2 pies today for take-out - 1 margarita pizza & 1 vegan Mook.  Got them home & discovered both were burnt - the margarita bottom crust, and the Mook crust & veggies on the pizza. Very disappointed.  Won't be going back.
Yummy pizza!!
Family friendly,. Nice atmosphere, old school Brooklyn. Grate pizza.
Staff is friendly. Food was great . Spinach and the Prosciutto Rice balls so nice n loved the Lord of Brooklyn Pizza.
Food was amazing and that staff was also, can't wait to go back
Great food get the Firefly potatoes. PuA AMAZING ALSO GOOD DRINKS

Our favorite date spot! Felt safe and distanced. Some shortages on our favorite beer and they didn’t have chicken but I understand sourcing is hard during this time. The wait also was not ideal. I recommend if someone is waiting for a table outside to bring them water as it is really hot and we waited a while. Regardless everyone is nice and helpful and food is delicious.

The pizza is to die for! I and rest of food is really good. The weekends with the live music are really nice. I love this place. I am bad with names but the pizza with figs is the most delicious pizza ever.

We came the first night that restaurants reopened, with outdoor seating. The wait for the food was long, it seemed like they were shorthanded in the kitchen, but the service was great. And when the food finally came, it was SO delicious!! My kids went crazy over the pizza. We'll definitely be back.

Ordered the mushroom pizza and it was AMAZING. I hope they continue to thrive and be prosperous during these crazy times as they are a gem. Thank you Brooklyn Firefly for providing excellent service anytime we order from there.
Food could have better.
ugh, overcrowded, and the pizza was cold and stale.
Their Vegan pizza is nothing in comparison to Lombardo’s.

Came in for after-dinner drinks and a vocal jazz set on Valentine's Day. Both were excellent, as was the dim, chill, and old-school atmosphere. We were able to get seats right near the stage despite the holiday crowd, and service was fast & friendly. Looking forward to stopping by for a full meal really soon.
Live bands good obviance and family friendly
It's good just not that many options other than pizza but if that's what you are going for than it was great.
Atmosphere is fun, nostalgic; pizza is awesome and bonus live music covering Tom Waits.
Delicious!
Came here for my girlfriend's birthday. Great food, awesome atmosphere, definitely recommend! The Lento's Ghost pie and The Smokey Calzone we very tasty!
An awesome, cozy local restaurant offering pizza and more. They have some great drinks and live jazz sometimes
Loved mushroom pie, 86th street pie and rice balls. Favorite local pizza place
Live music and fresh pizza/calzones what can go wrong. Fantastic experience.
Love there pizza!
Best thin crust pizza.

I was attracted to Firefly because, unlike most pizzerias in Bay Ridge, Firefly had a vegan pizzeria menu. Granted, most pizza without meat additions are vegan (though you can debate cheese). The vegan part of menu is vegan. The standard menu pizzas do have meat add-on enhancements. So if you're vegan in the purest sense, would you enjoy vegan pizza baked in same oven with meat? Pizza is flavorful and competes well against its many neighbors in immediate vicinity. My only gripe is that vegan pizza should not be baked in same oven used for meat. I don't want meat aromas or tastes drifting to my vegan pizza. So unless standard menu adds soy-based meats in liu of prosciutto (etc), I can't call Firefly a truly vegan pizzeria. For this, I've given it a reluctant 4 stars for effort. More vegans, as well as arabic and jewish  neighbors, might give it 2 or 3 stars. For me, Firefly is an ordinary pizza par excellence but not REALLY vegan. Firefly should not be compared to vegan restaurants in their area.
Best Pezza in Brooklyn!
A fresh, flavorful, and high-quality food. Sitting section was comfortable and beautiful.
Warm and friendly service, great atmosphere, dynamite menu that's not too expensive.  Really a great spot.  Set up outdoors if you can and on weekends there is great jazz and live music.
Good brunch spot
Love it

Very good pizza.  Had 3 pies and a salad for 6 adults and that was plenty.  They have indoor and ourdoor seating.  We had a pie called a margarita, a mook, one with warm honey and pepperoni but I forgot the name. I liked them all. The service was very friendly.
Food was delicious and the staff was friendly. Drinks where refreshing and affordable. Will be going again.
Great local pizza spot. Great outside seating
Great pizza! Drinks are good too. Loved the outdoor seating here as well
This place is awesome great food good atmosphere and the owner is real hospitable
Nice place to go with friends and/or family.  Very warmly.
I liked it.
Loved it, awesome New year's here yummy 😋 food

it was ausome and so Mello and I love the atmosphere the food was great
Great pizza, nice music and great staff. A hidden gem in Brooklyn. I will be back and I highly recommend
Taste of Brooklyn.
Top top
Great place. Brunch was delicious

New York has cheap pizza on every corner; visit the Brooklyn Firefly for something truly delicious. Each pizza pie is absolutely divine. It is easy to lose yourself in multiple slices of bliss, but be sure to save some for your friends and family! Our favorite is the "Lord of Brooklyn" with its perfectly delicate sausage.  The non-pizza items are equally good. "Mama's Meatball" is the best meatball I ever ordered in my life.  On top of the food and cozy setting, there is live music on Friday and Saturday nights.  The only downside is that bay ridge can be hard to get to from other parts of NYC. But hey, explore! Take a scenic drive westward across the Belt and share this experience with someone special. Great spot for friends and dates alike.
(Translated by Google) That sucks  (Original) Do dupy
The best
Wonderful staff free round on the house delicious food the calzone burger was Soo good.  Thank you waitress !!
Loved the food.
Pizza is excellent
Great food, although the time for the food to deliver could he a little quicker, I enjoyed it overall
After u eat u need 2 eat again we had lentos.           ghost pie it was so small I ordered something else a big meatball that was small by any standard I went home 2 eat. I owe the number
Love this place...great food and good music
Square pie is life!
Great pizza. Went on a Friday and the there was a cool live jazz band.
Amazing fresh ingredient wood oven pizzas! The vibe is relaxed, family friendly plus great local talents performing.

Came here on a Friday night around 630pm, hoping to catch HH. We were seated in the back where the band plays (at 8pm) - very cute place with lights hanging on the ceiling. We were told that Happy Hour is only at the bar from 5-7pm, so we ended up moving to the bar. ($2 off any drinks over $6)  As for the pizzas, they have plenty of delicious choices, while they don't to half and half..our bartender,  Niko suggested that we can order a personal pie ($12) each so we can try whatever we wanted.  Really enjoyed the Saturday Night Fever (Hot soppressata, Hot Honey, Caramelize Onions, Tomato Sauce & Mozz)  Very cute spot! Parking is a bit tough..as with any places near Bay Ridge.
I appreciate the vibe at Firefly.  The food is great and they have some speciality cocktails that are fun.
Food was amazing but a little bit of a wait but soooooo worth it!
Bad empty and service was bad to
It has a lot of potential, just needs better management and refining. The pizza was doughy and service was slow and unattentive. But otherwise everything was good.
The food and atmosphere are great but the service was extremely slow and forgetful.
Horrible food tastes horrible and they forgot about my order.
Good place , good food.

Went for the first time with a group, food was excellent. The menu states that groups over 6 people will incur a 20% gratuity charge. Ok. So when the bill came, 4 of us had credit cards, the rest cash. We wrote it down on the back of the bill for the waitress to make it easier for her. When I gave her the bill and told her, she had an attitude. Then she came back and said the credit cards would get charged a fee. When we got the receipts, each card was charged $1.20 cashless fee, but also they were charged tax again, which we already calculated and paid. So we got the manager who said the credit card fee is written on the bill, which of course we didnt see bc we have never had this happen, nor does it state this on the menu. So the manager gave us back the tax in cash but this should never have even happened in the first place. Sorry but its bad business for any restaurant to charge a fee for credit cards! Now im not sure i want to go back and deal with a waitress with an attitude who gave us an empty ketchup and pepper and didnt fix it right away, besides the credit card fee. Do better!
Great food and atmosphere

The pizza and the meatball were both so good. We ordered one of the thin crust ones, and it was done well and tasted great. &We could not get enough of Mama's Meatball! It was a weekday dinner date. Great ambiance. Will be back!
Delicious food amazing service  Good pricing pricing
Good food.
Some of the best pizza in Bay Ridge. I’ve found the staff to be somewhat cold. Not rude, necessarily, but distant and certainly not friendly.
Delicious pizza and great atmosphere!!
Love. This. Place.
Delicious

Amazing atmosphere, delicious food, great staff - a truly pleasurable experience that is all grounded in GREAT PIZZA, which seems harder and harder to find these days. This menu is so unique and all the ingredients are fresh and top quality. Being family owned and operated, you can feel how much love goes into everything, from the extremely personalized menu, to the care in curating the atmosphere, to the perfectly prepared food. Really can't go wrong with this place!
Life music, testy pizza and huge choice of the  coctails
Daughter-in-law's favorite pizza joint where they will leave off the stinky cheese when asked. YAY!

Bartenders are very friendly, as is the wait staff. If you're into mushrooms and truffle oil, get The Shrooms pizza. It's SO well done. The other pizzas are very good, but The Shrooms overshadows all of them and it's hard to not order it every visit.  For reference, I've also tried their Vodka Square, Bad Racket, and 86th Street pies. Ceasar salad was just okay, their "Fire Fries" are actually smashed potatoes and pretty decent.  Closed Mondays.  UPDATE: Well I was guilted into trying another pie and now I'm torn; their other white pie (Scalabesh) is also delectable. So I have 2 favorites now. Thank God I live close.
Music = 👌
Great pizza great music
Delicious pizza and the music scene is pretty tight

The pizzas are very fresh and original. There is definitely one that will fit your taste buds. The burger was decent. The fire fries were amazing though. They were very unique and we're quite crispy with a nice soft fluffy inside. The "thick" milkshake however was not thick. It was more whipped and not worth the price. Overall the experience was great. I would only order pizza and fries when I come here again.

Nothing crazy on the pizza, the bar can be slightly understaffed which equates to long waits for drinks. Overall, and average bay ridge bar with an artisan pizza flare that is not so artisanal. Looks decent and has outdoor seating, which is a plus in the summer.

Back in the day this used to be Lentos Pizzeria....and gotta say they did a freaking awesome job in replicating how Lentos did their pizza! So thin, crispy, non-greasy, super delicious and fresh! Love how they have live bands during the weekends. Great place for a family, friends, and romantic for a date.
Good food, very attentive staff, nice beer selection.

This is hands-down the hippest place in bay ridge. Insanely good pizza (I’ve tried probably 75% of them and have never been disappointed) on top of awesome aesthetics. I live 4 stops away, but this is by far my go-to for good pizza and a cool atmosphere. Live music is great as well.
Food was great!
Great pizza.  Nice atmosphere.
bartender wasn't very friendly almost as if he didn't want us there
Awesome pizza.

Food was ok... service was very good.. price was good.. they do the old lento pizza.. but it was nothing great.

What a great place. I split a calzone with someone and it was the perfect amount to eat on a date if that makes any sense. Every calzone variety is fantastic. Decent selection of beers and great staff. Food was fast and we weren't rushed to leave.  The decor can keep you distracted during awkward pauses. We went on a weeknight at around 8:30 and it was fairly empty. And that was fine. If you live near by, skip the Uber and opt for a romantic walk home. I will eat here again.
Family friendly great atmosphere!
FOOD is Delicious ,,everyones treated like family ,, my kids love ❤️ the place ,,can’t wait too come back !!!!

Loved this place - food, style, vibe
Food is good pizza is great
Live music!
Great pizza and bar spot with an outdoor. Solid beer selection, unique vibe and music.
Great pizza, service was a little slow but the staff was great
Best pizzas in bay ridge. Nice terrace. Good selection of beers, hard ciders n wines. And black n white movies playing all night at the bar - nice dining + movie night
Great pizzas and great atmosphere. There was a jazz band playing while we were there which was entertaining. Friendly wait staff.
Beautiful place

How many stars do you give when the food is really tasty and well prepared, but the service is just unrelentingly terrible? How does a restaurant seem to have so many staff members but none who are attentive to the customers?  If you do decide to brave a visit, have no plans for after, and get as Zen as you can before you go, because really, you'll enjoy the food (get those smashed potatoes!) but you will be so very very frustrated by the experience as a whole. Hopefully it's a nice night and you're sitting outside, which is not a terrible way to spend an evening.
Yummy pizza. They can be slow. So just make extra time.

I really want to give this place a better review. Outdoor seating was nice and plentiful, the pizza was really good. BUT! The service was the worst I've had in the city. Even the two tables next to us joked that maybe our waiter left for the night. There were plenty of staff walking around (6-8 people) but couldn't get any one to stop and get us more water and waited around 20 minutes before someone would get our bill and card so we could pay and leave (wasn't our waiter either). Maybe service is better inside? Three times a waiter tried to bring us drinks we didn't order, they'd walk away and we'd hear another table comment about how that might have been their drinks. So much potential here though.

Here's why I picked this place: vegan options, they display local art on the walls and there's a vintage vibe. Here's why I loved this place: EVERYTHING. Seriously, from the cocktails to the giant meatball appetizer to the pizza, it's just all around amazing. The servers are so friendly and the decor is absolutely gorgeous. This place is fully wheelchair-accessible, with a restroom on the main level AND comfortable seating to accommodate everyone. They have a back area that's elevated where bands appear to play and sidewalk seating to boot.

Awesome place ! Delicious food, great service, unbeatable prices,  excellent experience ! My wife and I were looking for a nice cozy place to relax and listen to some jazz. This place exceeded our expectations. Professional and attentive hostess took great care of us as we arrived a little early for our reservation . BTW highly recommend reservation and getting there early, as the place gets very busy and getting a table close to the band might  be difficult. Hostess was able to seat us right next to the stage - front row seats to witness a perfect performance by Baby Soda Band. The food was beyond delicious.  Our waiter, Bryan was spot on, very attentive as well. Got our food fairly quickly. Nice touch having windows from dining area into the kitchen,  so we could see the food being made. My wife had a couple of Espresso Martinis that were made perfectly. Restaurant has a great atmosphere and between interior decor and the music we were able to leave today's hectic and stressed out world and find ourselves in 1930's. Would give them 10 stars . Looking forward to visiting The Brooklyn Firefly again.
Cozy neighborhood spot
Hosted a birthday gathering at The Brooklyn Firefly today and the food was absolutely delicious! Highly recommend.
Tasty pizza. Expensive cocktails that weren't worth the money.  Overall too expensive.
Awesome Atmoshere and pizza
Amazing food atmosphere and service

I love this place! Definitely one of the coolest places in our neighborhood. Love the atmosphere. If you ever need a place to take your city friends that is kinda cool (for Bayridge), not trashy and low key, this is the place. The pizza is amazing!! And they have vegan pizza, the Mook. Soooo good!! Don't love their cocktails. Wish they had more tasty cocktails, but other than that, I highly recommend it.

We are big fans of The Brooklyn Firefly! Always family friendly when we eat in with kids and a great date night atmosphere, especially on weekends with live entertainment. The menu only seems to get better and the drinks are on point! Pizzas are so fresh and delicious, the roasted potatoes with ricotta are amazing, and the burger is really good too!

Horrible experience- my fiancé made a wrong order by mistake and when we called over the waitress to apologize & try to switch it out, she just stared at us for an uncomfortably long time. The ambiance was wonderful, and the food was actually pretty good but the service was garbage.
Delicious thin crust pizza, fresh ingredients, and great atmosphere.
Great pizza and friendly staff, plus a full bar!
Sister sings here regularly pizza and wine good prices . Love it.
Good spot to go to decompress after a long week.
All of the food was delicious. Had the chicken cuzzie, meatball, arugula salad and chocolate mousse cake 😍
Charming old school pizza joint.  Terrific menu, good cooking.
Lovely pizza place with outdoor seating. Good pizza. Great kale salad. Must try the Firefly drink.
Great pizza place, very cozy and good music!
Good selection of beers and fantastic beers. A very welcoming atmosphere, this is a great place to spend a Sunday afternoon.
Good food and service. Music is great!
A rather hip place for a bay ridge establishment. The pizza was good. Nice sized bar as well.

Some strange, weird and wonderful choices of toppings for your pizzas from years gone by. I reluctantly agreed to share a mashed potato pizza with my wife and expected the worst. It was actually very tasty and I found myself wanting more! Great atmosphere in here. Give it a go
Good beer selection, great pizza, and a fun space for a gathering or party. If I lived closer, I would be visiting this bar more.

Nice and cozy except we were a table of 5 and we didn't realize waitress was also the bartender, so it was frustrating always looking for her when we wanted to order more stuff. Had to get up to pay Bill also. Otherwise it's an ok place.
Great pies, great music
Nice place, but food wasn't very good
The ambience was very good. There was live music. The pizza was good but not extraordinary.
Great pizzas, rice balls, and jazz music in the evening. Wonderful service and kitchen staff too.

username: Karlla A. P. de Lima Davis

caption: Thee best spot in all of Bay Ridge... Great food, great music and a very cool vibe...
The restaurant has a good ambience, tried 86th street pizza. It was good. They have a good collection of wines and cocktails.
Great pizza, great atmosphere... Whoever played love music on Wednesdays was amazing! Recommend the mushroom pizza
Amazing decor jazz cool atmosphere with a retro nostalgia touch spot on service and the pizza it's soooooooooo damn good . Grimaldis can kiss my ......... you fill the dots.
Vegan-friendly! Good drinks, great outdoor space.
Great food and music
Horrible service thought payment was tip

A classic old school feel with an Artists touch. Musician/Graffiti/Tattoo Artist Kaves is cooking up a masterpiece in Bay Ridge but this time its pizza! The pizza was definitely up in the ranks with some of Brooklyn's best. Krispy yet light flavorful dough topped with homemade sauce how your grandma made it all with a great combination of fresh toppings.What more can you ask for? Well for starters great homemade riceballs, craft beers, dope graffiti art on the walls, live music and a big outdoor area. Walking around this place the attention to detail was on point from the creative menu, hand painted signs to Ruby's lemonade stand it puts out a one of a kind family owned vibe that will surely become a brooklyn staple like the Honeymooners. This place is a great neighborhood joint worth the trip to check it out. Looking forward to Sunday suppa at The Brooklyn Firefly.

Went with my wife and 2yo daughter the other night and sat outside.  First, the service was EXTREMELY SLOW and if I hadn't asked the bus girl and hostess multiple times for a server to take our order or even get our check, we may still be there. Either they are understaffed or the need to get more attentive, more appreciative wait staff.  We had a Margarita Pizza which was yummy, but a little soggy in the center for thin crust. Leftover slices toasted nicely in oven though.  Also had the giant meatball. Surprised how good it was because of its size. It is stuffed with mozzarella cheese (not a big fan of stuffed meatballs, but my daughter liked the cheesie parts. Good to split.  There Aoili French fried potatoes are the best. Its more of a deep fried smashed potatoes. Super crispy outside and the aioli sauce was delicious.  Would give 4 stars jut again our dinning experience fell short due to the lack of attention from the wait staff. On a side note, the table busser were more attentive and friendlier than the servers. I gave the young lady a tip for her help. I took it out of the tip the waitress would have gotten if only she'd been of any help.  We'll return and try again.
Good ambiance and good food. Sangria was strong and refreshing, pizza was delish.
Awesome Pizza, great vibe. Love the nastalgia

Great thin crust pizza with excellent toppings and some of the best rice balls I've had in a long time. Attentive wait staff and live though may it be very loud live entertainment. The place itself is very nicely decorated and the art on the walls is by local artists and is for sale. There is however one negative thing I wish to mention. Stay away from the wine. I know markups are the norm and I can accept that but paying 9 dollars for a glass with maybe 3 ounces is pretty ridiculous. I took a picture of it but it is a bit dark and hard to see and doesn't do the silliness of it all justice. That's how you make your 12 bottle of wine worth at least 72 bucks...
Great pizza. Live music. Great atmosphere. Reasonably priced!

Relaxed, comfortable atmosphere, great cocktails, and phenomenally good vegan pizza.  We had been skipping this spot for a while because the online menu didn't seem to have any vegan options.  Thankfully, we poked our head in during the summer stroll and checked out a menu and noticed that they did have a pizza specifically labeled as vegan!  The Mook is absolutely incredible.  We're so thrilled to have a vegan pizza option so close to home.
Great place and staff!!

Everything on the menu is delicious.  Outdoor seating is really cool and family friendly.  All the waiting staff if awesome only had the occasional hostess who doesn't acknowledge you right away otherwise one of our favorite places.
Live entertainment good food and tartufo!!
Always a comfortable and welcoming atmosphere. The food and service are top notch
Awesome atmosphere and cocktails and specialty Brooklyn style PIZZA!A lovely place to enjoy your drinks! Great music and an enjoyable enviroment!
Great food, fantastic ambiance, good music
I love this place! Beautiful music,nice atmosphere & good food. I am going again there for sure. Good job guys!

Awesome pizza spot with delicious Italian desserts! There is a retro laid back vibe throughout the space that sort of gives off the feel of a speakeasy. It's dark colored walls are decorated with local artist artwork and the pieces are …
Pies are great!! Highly recommend their 'fries'.
Amazing food and excellent service and atmosphere. Will be going back several times.
Good burger. Good pizza.
Good atmosphere, service, pizza and beers.

Awesome pizza.  The owners Mr Kraves and Ray are great people.   The music is awesome.   I did post one on youtube a few weeks ago.  The bar part is very good too.  My girlfriend and I highly recommend this place.
Good pizza in an Old Timey atmosphere. There's sometimes live jazz in the back.
Great food and the best chocolate Martinis in Bay Ridge! In
Great pizza, fun atmosphere, live music.

The staff here was very friendly and the place had a very relaxed vibe. Grabbed a square pie on happy hour for half price which was a great deal and owner said they intend to mix it up with offering different pies at half price for happy hour.  As a beer lover the selection was good but not great, however there were still some excellent beers like the easy drink Krombacher Pilsner which actually goes well with pizza.
Great food Great atmosphere and Great service and really nice place inside and out
Good service and the cheesecake cannoli is 💯💯💯💯💯💯👌👍🔥🔥. I could have lived without the squealing banshee that was singing though.
